title: Ticket #6231: DAGMan parse failures not handled correctly on Windows
description: When DAGMan encounters a parsing error (invalid tokens, reserved words, no node name, etc.) on Windows, condor_scheduniv_exec.1.0 fails to exit cleanly. This results in the job being rescheduled instead of failing outright. We can work around this by throwing a debug_error() message, which triggers DC_Exit(), but this is approach might have side effects. Need to figure out why these parse errors aren't being handled correctly on Windows and resolve it.
creator: coatsworth
